issues.title: Create hardcoded exercise library
issues.body:
## Description
Create a data structure containing 10-15 basic exercises that can be used in workout routines.

## Requirements
- Include exercise name
- Include default duration/reps
- Include difficulty level (beginner/intermediate)
- Store in a structured format (JSON, Python dict, or class)

## Example Exercises
- Jumping Jacks
- Bodyweight Squats
- Push-ups (modified and regular)
- Plank
- Lunges
- High Knees
- Mountain Climbers
- Burpees
- Arm Circles
- Crunches

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] At least 10 exercises defined
- [ ] Each exercise has name, duration/reps, and difficulty level
- [ ] Data structure is easily accessible by other components

issues.title: Implement fitness level intent
issues.body:
## Description
Create an intent handler that captures and stores the user's fitness level.

## Requirements
- Prompt user to select fitness level (beginner/intermediate)
- Validate user input
- Store fitness level for the current session
- Handle invalid responses gracefully

## Example Flow
```
Bot: Welcome! Are you a beginner or intermediate exerciser?
User: Beginner
Bot: Great! [proceeds to next question]
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] User can specify beginner or intermediate
- [ ] Invalid inputs are handled with helpful error messages
- [ ] Fitness level is stored for routine generation

issues.title: Implement time availability intent
issues.body:
## Description
Create an intent handler that captures how much time the user has available for their workout.

## Requirements
- Prompt user to select available time (15 min / 30 min / 45 min)
- Validate user input
- Store time selection for routine generation
- Handle invalid responses gracefully

## Example Flow
```
Bot: How much time do you have today?
User: 20 minutes
Bot: Perfect! Here's your 20-minute workout...
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] User can specify time (15/30/45 minutes or similar)
- [ ] System accepts approximate times and rounds appropriately
- [ ] Invalid inputs are handled with helpful error messages
- [ ] Time is stored for routine generation

issues.title: Build workout routine generator
issues.body:
## Description
Create logic to generate appropriate workout routines based on user's fitness level and available time.

## Requirements
- Generate routines based on fitness level (beginner/intermediate)
- Generate routines based on time (15/30/45 min)
- Minimum 3 pre-built routines:
  - Beginner 15 min
  - Beginner 30 min
  - Intermediate 30 min
- Select 3-5 exercises per routine
- Include repetition instructions (e.g., "Repeat 2x")

## Example Output
```
Perfect! Here's your 20-minute beginner workout:
1. Jumping Jacks - 2 minutes
2. Bodyweight Squats - 10 reps
3. Push-ups (modified) - 5 reps
4. Plank - 30 seconds
5. Repeat 2x
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] At least 3 distinct pre-built routines
- [ ] Routines contain 3-5 exercises
- [ ] Exercises match user's fitness level
- [ ] Total routine duration matches requested time
- [ ] Clear instructions for reps/duration/sets

issues.title: Implement get routine intent
issues.body:
## Description
Create an intent handler that generates and displays a workout routine to the user.

## Requirements
- Trigger routine generation based on user's fitness level and time
- Display routine in a clear, formatted way
- Ask if user wants explanations for any exercises
- Handle cases where user hasn't set level/time yet

## Example Flow
```
User: Give me a workout
Bot: Perfect! Here's your 20-minute beginner workout:
     1. Jumping Jacks - 2 minutes
     2. Bodyweight Squats - 10 reps
     ...
     Want me to explain any exercise?
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Routine is generated based on stored preferences
- [ ] Routine displays clearly with numbered list
- [ ] User is prompted if they want exercise explanations
- [ ] Handles missing user preferences gracefully

issues.title: Integrate AI API for exercise explanations
issues.body:
## Description
Integrate with an AI API (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) to provide detailed exercise explanations when users ask.

## Requirements
- Set up API client for chosen AI service
- Create prompts that generate helpful exercise explanations
- Focus on proper form, common mistakes, and modifications
- Handle API errors gracefully
- Keep explanations concise and beginner-friendly

## Example Interaction
```
User: How do I do a plank?
Bot: Great question! Here's how to do a proper plank:
     - Start in a push-up position
     - Keep your body in a straight line...
     [AI-generated detailed explanation]
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] AI API is configured with credentials
- [ ] Exercise explanations are clear and helpful
- [ ] API errors are handled without crashing
- [ ] Response time is reasonable (< 5 seconds)

issues.title: Implement explain exercise intent
issues.body:
## Description
Create an intent handler that detects when users ask for exercise explanations and triggers the AI API.

## Requirements
- Detect when user asks about an exercise
- Extract exercise name from user query
- Call AI API with appropriate prompt
- Display explanation to user
- Handle exercises not in the library

## Example Flow
```
User: How do I do a plank?
Bot: [Calls AI API and displays explanation]

User: Explain squats
Bot: [Calls AI API and displays explanation]
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Detects exercise explanation requests
- [ ] Extracts exercise name correctly
- [ ] Generates helpful AI explanations
- [ ] Handles unknown exercises gracefully

issues.title: Implement workout completion tracking
issues.body:
## Description
Create a system to track when users complete workouts and maintain a count.

## Requirements
- Save workout completion count to a file
- Increment count when user indicates they finished
- Persist count across sessions
- Display encouraging message with count

## Example Flow
```
User: Done!
Bot: Awesome! That's workout #3 this week. Keep going! ðŸ’ª
```

## Technical Notes
- Use simple file storage (JSON or text file)
- Store count with timestamp if possible
- Consider storing by user if multiple users supported

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Workout count persists to file
- [ ] Count increments correctly
- [ ] Count persists across app restarts
- [ ] Encouraging message displayed with count

issues.title: Implement log completion intent
issues.body:
## Description
Create an intent handler that detects when users complete a workout and triggers the tracking system.

## Requirements
- Detect completion phrases ("done", "finished", "completed")
- Increment workout counter
- Display motivational message
- Show current workout count

## Example Flow
```
User: I'm done!
Bot: Awesome! That's workout #3 this week. Keep going! ðŸ’ª

User: Finished
Bot: Great job! That's workout #4 this week. You're on fire!
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Detects various completion phrases
- [ ] Increments counter correctly
- [ ] Displays motivational messages
- [ ] Shows accurate workout count

issues.title: Create main conversational interface
issues.body:
## Description
Build the main conversational loop that ties all intents together into a cohesive user experience.

## Requirements
- Welcome message when app starts
- Route user input to appropriate intent handlers
- Maintain conversation context
- Handle unknown/invalid inputs gracefully
- Provide help/guidance when needed

## Example Flow
```
Bot: Welcome! Are you a beginner or intermediate exerciser?
User: Beginner
Bot: How much time do you have today?
User: 20 minutes
Bot: Perfect! Here's your 20-minute beginner workout:
     [routine displayed]
     Want me to explain any exercise?
User: How do I do a plank?
Bot: [explanation]
User: Done!
Bot: Awesome! That's workout #3 this week.
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Welcome message displays on startup
- [ ] All 4 intents are accessible
- [ ] Conversation flows naturally
- [ ] Unknown inputs receive helpful responses
- [ ] User can exit gracefully

issues.title: Add input validation and error handling
issues.body:
## Description
Implement comprehensive input validation and error handling throughout the application.

## Requirements
- Validate all user inputs
- Provide helpful error messages
- Handle edge cases (empty input, invalid formats, etc.)
- Gracefully handle API failures
- Don't crash on unexpected input

## Areas to Cover
- Fitness level selection
- Time selection
- Exercise name extraction
- File I/O operations
- API calls

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Invalid inputs show helpful error messages
- [ ] App doesn't crash on bad input
- [ ] API failures are handled gracefully
- [ ] File operations have error handling
- [ ] User always knows what went wrong and what to do

issues.title: Add unit tests for core functionality
issues.body:
## Description
Write unit tests to ensure core functionality works correctly.

## Test Coverage Areas
- Exercise library data structure
- Routine generation logic
- Intent detection
- Workout counter increment/persist
- Input validation functions

## Example Tests
- Test that beginner 15-min routine has appropriate exercises
- Test that workout counter increments correctly
- Test that invalid fitness level is rejected
- Test that exercise library has minimum required exercises

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Test files created
- [ ] Core functions have test coverage
- [ ] All tests pass
- [ ] Tests can be run with single command
- [ ] Edge cases are tested
